definition: Yang Yuhuan or Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
poplar
surname Yang
jade
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
surname Huan

sentences.english: The Lord went down into the water and came up with Mallika Sherawat .
sentences.chinese: 上帝跳進河裏然後帶出來楊玉環。

sentences.english: There was a beautiful girl named Yang Yuhuan who was selected into the palace in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝開元年間，有一美貌女子叫楊玉環，被選進宮來。

sentences.english: This is the hot spring bathing pool Li Longji gave his concubine Yang Yuhuan.
sentences.chinese: 這就是李隆基送給妃子楊玉環的溫泉浴池。

definition: lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
Yuan Emperor, reign name of Han Dynasty emperor Liu Shi 劉奭|刘奭[Liu2 Shi4], (74-33 BC), reigned 48-33 BC
see 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
beauty unmatched in her generation (idiom); woman of peerless elegance/prettiest girl ever
taboo name (e.g. of emperor)
to settle a marriage/betrothal
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
turmoil/social upheaval
imperial concubine
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
outstanding talent (idiom); incomparable artistic merit
